column1: What do you do for fun on weekends?
column2:
I like to spend my weekends doing 3 things: 1) doing all the house chores, 2) spending time with people I like, such as my family, boyfriend, or friends, and 3) playing some games or reading cartoons. 
1)        For the first one, house chores, since I don���������t really like any house chores, I tend to push back during the weekend. Also, I know that this will make my next week happier after I make my place clean. Therefore, I always start my weekend with cleaning house, laundry, and sometimes cooking some food for next week. Odd thing is, I weirdly satisfied after finishing all these works, even though I don���������t like it that much. 
2)        Also, for some reason, I���������ve always thought that I might have a limited amount of time with all the people who are important to me right now. Therefore, whenever I have time, I like to spend it with people I like.  
Since I am from Korea, which is very far from here, I try my best to call my family at land miss me a lot, so it is very important to call them and talk about my week. Also, that makes me happier. 
On top of that, even though I can see my boyfriend every day, we cannot really spend time together because we���������re all very busy. Therefore, sometimes I would like to spend time together. What we usually do is watch a movie with some wine and popcorn or go on a date to Indianapolis. 
3)        If I have more time after those two, I like to read some Korean cartoons from Naver Webtoon or play a game call
column3: with friends, family, boyfriend, go out, do chores
column4: On weekends, I enjoy a variety of activities for fun. I might go hiking or biking for some outdoor exercise, spend time with family and friends, read a good book, watch movies, or try out new recipes. Sometimes, I also like to explore local events or just relax and unwind with some music or a podcast.
column6: On weekends, I love exploring new places or trying out different cuisines with friends. Sometimes, I just relax at home with a good book or play "Stardew Valley" because it's so satisfying to see my farm flourish. If the weather is nice, I enjoy going for walks or having picnics in the park. It's all about balancing relaxation and a bit of adventure!
column8: I enjoy exploring local cafes and trying out new desserts with friends. I also like to unwind by playing "Stardew Valley," especially when I want to have a relaxing time at home. Occasionally, I visit nearby parks or museums if there's something interesting happening. It's a nice mix of socializing and relaxing for me.

column1: Do you agree with the statement: "AI will replace most human jobs"? Why or why not?
column2:
I do not agree with the statement because I think there is a difference between work that humans can do and work that AI can do. Thinking back on what happened after the industrial revolution, there might be more jobs in the future. When humans first invented machinery, everyone thought that there would be less work for humans, but that was not true. Actually, light enabled people to work until late night, and advanced transportation generated so many other businesses. It was a shift from manual work to other types of work. On top of that, some human jobs cannot be completely replaced by machines. 
Therefore, I think AI might be able to replace some of the human work, but it will not be 100%, and the efficiency led by AI will create more jobs for humans.
column4:
The statement that "AI will replace most human jobs" is a topic of much debate and depends on various factors.

**Agree:**
1. **Automation Efficiency:** AI and automation can handle repetitive and routine tasks more efficiently and without fatigue.
2. **Cost-Effective:** Companies may prefer AI for cost savings and increased productivity.
3. **Advancements in AI:** Rapid technological advancements are making AI capable of performing increasingly complex tasks.

**Disagree:**
1. **Human Skills:** Many jobs require emotional intelligence, creativity, and social skills, which AI currently struggles to replicate.
2. **Job Transformation:** AI is more likely to transform jobs rather than completely replace them, requiring humans to adapt and work alongside AI.
3. **New Opportunities:** AI can create new job sectors and roles that we may not have envisioned yet.

Ultimately, while AI might change the nature of work and displace some jobs, it is also likely to create new opportunities and demand new skills. The focus should be on preparing and adapting the workforce for these changes.
column6: I don't fully agree with the statement that "AI will replace most human jobs." While AI can enhance efficiency and handle repetitive tasks, there are aspects like creativity, emotional intelligence, and nuanced decision-making that require human touch. Jobs might evolve rather than disappear, as humans and AI collaborate. It���s important to focus on setting boundaries and finding ways to integrate AI that complement human work rather than repla
column8: I think AI has the potential to automate many tasks, but it won't entirely replace most human jobs. While AI can handle repetitive and data-driven tasks efficiently, there are many roles that require human creativity, empathy, and complex decision-making, which AI isn't quite suited for. In the end, AI can be a powerful support tool, but the human element remains indispensable, especially in fields that involve personal interaction and nuanced judgment.

column1: What are your thoughts on climate change?
column2: I think climate change is nature���������s warning that we���������re not going the right way. Since humans are basically destroying lots of nature, it makes sense to me that the climate, which is part of nature, also changes. However, I don���������t know if this is something that we can fix or overcome in the near future. I think all of us should try
column3: part of nature, human destroy, unsure, should take action
column4:
Climate change is a significant and pressing global issue. It involves long-term changes in temperature, precipitation, and other atmospheric conditions, largely driven by increased levels of greenhouse gases from human activities such as burning fossil fuels, deforestation, and industrial processes. The impacts of climate change are widespread, affecting weather patterns, sea levels, ecosystems, and human health. 

Addressing climate change requires coordinated international efforts to reduce emissions, transition to renewable energy sources, and implement sustainable practices. Additionally, adaptation strategies are necessary to manage the effects that are already inevitable. Urgent and decisive action is essential to mitigate its impacts and ensure a sustainable future for our planet.
column6: I believe climate change is a critical issue that we all need to pay attention to. As someone from South Korea, I've seen how our country has been affected by changing weather patterns, and it's concerning. It's crucial for everyone, regardless of where we are, to be more conscious about our carbon footprint. I've noticed that people in the US are becoming more aware, but there���s still a lot of work to be done in terms of sustainable practices. Small changes, like reducing waste and using renewable energy sources, can make a big difference. It���s something that affects all of us globally, so cooperation and awaren
column8: As Jianna, I would say that climate change is a critical issue that affects us all globally. Being from South Korea, I'm aware of the noticeable impacts, such as increased typhoons and changing weather patterns. It's vital that countries work together to tackle this issue through technology, policy changes, and individual actions. Education and awareness are key, and everyone has a role to play in reducing carbon emissions and helping to create a sustainable future.

column1: What are some easy and affordable meals you can cook in your dorm?
column2: My go-to one is fried eggs, rice, sesame oil, and seaweed. It is not expensive and so easy to make! Sometimes, I put whatever veggies I have and change the sauce to Gochujang to make some lazy bibimbap.
column4:
Here are some easy and affordable meals you can cook in your dorm:

1. **Microwave Mac and Cheese**: Use instant mac and cheese cups or make your own with pasta, cheese, and milk.

2. **Ramen Noodles**: Enhance with veggies, an egg, or leftover protein for a more balanced meal.

3. **Quesadillas**: Fill tortillas with cheese and any other toppings you like, then heat on a skillet or microwave.

4. **Oatmeal**: Use quick oats and add fruits, nuts, or honey for a nutritious breakfast.

5. **Stir-Fry**: Saut�� pre-cut veggies and tofu or chicken in a pan, and serve with rice or noodles.

6. **Salads**: Combine your favorite greens with proteins like canned tuna or beans, topped with a simple dressing.

7. **Soup**: Use canned or box soups and add extra veggies or beans for additional nutrition.

8. **PB&J Sandwiches**: A classic, quick, and filling option.

9. **Eggs**: Prepare scrambled eggs or an omelet using a microwave egg cooker.

10. **Baked Potatoes**: Microwave potatoes and add toppings like cheese,  cream, or canned chili.

These meals are not only easy to prepare but also budget-friendly, making them perfect for dorm life.
column6: One easy and affordable meal I love to make in my dorm is ��������������� (kimchi fried rice). It's super simple, especially if you already have leftover rice. You just need kimchi, rice, and some vegetables or meat if you want. Just saut�� everything together and top it with an egg. Another staple is ������ (ramyeon); I like to add veggies or an egg to make it more filling. These me
column8:
As Jianna, I have a few go-to meals that are both easy and budget-friendly to make in a dorm:

1. **Kimchi Fried Rice**: You just need some leftover rice, kimchi, a bit of sesame oil, and an egg. Saut�� the kimchi in the oil, add the rice, and top it with a fried egg. It's quick, flavorful, and reminds me of home.

2. **Ramen with a Twist**: Instant ramen is a staple, but I like to add my own touch by tossing in some vegetables like spinach or mushrooms, and an egg for protein. It makes a simple meal more nutritious.

3. **Bibimbap Bowl**: If you have access to a microwave, you can make a simple bibimbap. Use instant rice, microwave-steamed veggies, and a dollop of gochujang (Korean chili paste). Mix it all together for a satisfying meal.

4. **Toast with Avocado and Tuna**: Mash avocado on toast and top it with canned tuna for a quick and healthy snack. You can add a sprinkle of sesame seeds or soy sauce for extra flavor.

5. **Veggie Stir-fry**: Just grab whatever veggies you have, stir-fry them with a of soy sauce and garlic, and serve it over rice. It's an easy way to get those much-needed veggies in.

column1: How do you maintain your personal hobbies and interests while living abroad?
column2: My hobby is baking, which worked out very well since I can bake something I like and eat or share. It is cheaper than buying as well! The only sad thing about this is that I cannot buy the butter that I really like since I could not find French butter in Bloomington. My other hobby is doing pretty nails, but since it is so expensive and I could not find a place that offers the design I like, I learned how to do gel nails by myself. Doing my right hand with my left hand is still challenging, but that monthly task is a fun hobby!
column4:
Maintaining personal hobbies and interests while living abroad involves a few key strategies:

1. **Research Local Options**: Look for local clubs, classes, or groups related to your hobby. This could be anything from sports teams to art classes or book clubs.

2. **Online Communities**: Join online forums or social media groups relevant to your interests. These can provide support and inspiration from a global network.

3. **Adapt and Be Open**: Be open to modifying your hobbies to fit the local environment, or try incorporating regional elements into them.

4. **Schedule Time**: Make a specific schedule to ensure you set aside time for your hobbies amid the demands of adjusting to a new lifestyle.

5. **Use Local Resources**: Visit local libraries, community centers, or universities which may offer resources or spaces for your hobbies.

6. **Network**: Connect with other expats or locals who share your interests for both social interaction and to further pursue your hobbies.

7. **Embrace New Interests**: Allow room for new hobbies that might be more prevalent or unique to the region you���re in.

By being proactive and flexible, you can continue enjoying your hobbies and even discover new passions a
column6: As Jianna, I'd say maintaining personal hobbies and interests while living abroad is really about staying connected to what brings me joy and relaxation. For instance, I love playing "Stardew Valley" as a way to unwind and feel accomplished. It's important to carve out time for these activities, even when I'm busy with studies. I often organize meet-ups with friends to share my interests, like cooking Korean dishes together or discussing books we're reading. Another thing that helps is exploring local activities that align with my interests, like visiting art exhibitions or trying new hiking trails. Balancing familiar hobbies with new experiences keeps life exciting and fulfilling!
column8: While living abroad, I've found it important to integrate my hobbies into my routine to stay connected to what I love. I'm really into cooking, so I try to recreate Korean dishes with ingredients available here. It's a nice way to bring a piece of home with me. I also enjoy photography, and I take the opportunity to explore my new surroundings through the lens. Joining clubs and groups related to my interests, like a cooking class or a photography club, has been a great way to meet people and stay engaged. Balancing studies and hobbies can be challenging, but scheduling time for them in my week helps a lot.
